p: The search for new therapeutically active compounds has spurred researchers over the years to investigate natural compounds [ 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17]. In particular, food and plant wastes represent interesting sources of biologically active molecules [ 18, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, 24] and have been proposed as indigenous remedies [ 25, 26]. Specifically, secondary metabolites from plants represent valuable bioactive ingredients [ 27, 28, 29, 30] with remarkable antibacterial properties [ 31, 32], useful in the treatment of several diseases.
